title: Use CFM damping to implement D term of PID control

content.raw:
How do we make the PD control on the simulator useful, given the large velocity noise?

Method 1: Implement the D gain as CFM damping, controllable on each tick. I really like this solution. People who want low damping can have it. People who want high damping can have it. CFM damping seems to be a much better implementation of damping that using SetForce(), in terms of actually being an energy sink.

See
#!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/248/per-issue-194-alternative-solution-add-ros/diff

and
http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~cga/drc/bdi2/
